translation_keys.example: The principles that guide every project and partnership

structure.title: Automation-First Mindset
structure.description: We don't automate for the sake of technology—we obsess over eliminating your team's busywork. Every project starts with identifying what shouldn't require human time, then building systems that run themselves.

structure.title: Transparency & Communication
structure.description: No black boxes, no surprises. You'll see exactly what we're building, why we're making each decision, and where your investment goes. Weekly updates and open communication channels keep you in control.

structure.title: Results-Driven Development
structure.description: We measure success by outcomes, not deliverables. Your automation should save hours, your software should drive revenue. If it doesn't move the needle, we didn't do our job.

structure.title: Long-Term Partnership
structure.description: We're not building one-off projects—we're building relationships. Your business evolves, and we're here to adapt your systems as you scale. Our clients tend to stay clients.

semantic_html.section_tag: Use <section> with id='values' for anchor linking
semantic_html.heading_hierarchy: Use <h2> for section title, <h3> for value titles
semantic_html.value_structure: Use semantic <article> tag for each value card

aria_considerations: Section should have aria-labelledby pointing to section title
Icons are decorative: use aria-hidden='true' on icon elements
Ensure value titles are proper <h3> tags for screen reader navigation
Cards are non-interactive, so no focus states or keyboard handling needed
If cards become clickable in future, add role='button', tabindex='0', and keyboard handlers

layout: Section uses max-w-6xl container with responsive padding (py-20 md:py-32)
Values arranged in 2x2 responsive grid (1 col mobile, 2 col tablet/desktop)
Grid gap is gap-4 on mobile, gap-6 on desktop
Section header included with title and optional subtitle
value_cards: Each card has glassmorphism styling (bg-[#111113]/80 backdrop-blur-md)
Hover effects work: bg-white/[0.04] and border-white/20
Each card contains: icon, title, description
Icons are positioned at top-left, sized w-10 h-10 (mobile) to w-12 h-12 (desktop)
typography: Section title uses font-display with appropriate sizing (text-3xl to text-5xl)
Value titles use font-display font-semibold (text-xl to text-2xl)
Value descriptions use text-white/60 with font-light and leading-relaxed
All text has tracking-tight for tighter letter spacing
animations: Cards fade in with staggered delays (0.1s, 0.2s, 0.3s, 0.4s)
Section header animates before cards (title: 0s, subtitle: 0.1s)
No GSAP or complex scroll triggers needed
translations: Section title and subtitle pulled from translations
Each value has title, description, and icon name in translation data
accessibility: Section uses semantic <section> tag with id='values'
Value titles use <h3> tags for proper heading hierarchy
Color contrast meets WCAG AA standards
Cards are non-interactive, no keyboard navigation needed
responsive: Layout adapts correctly at all breakpoints (mobile: 1 col, tablet+: 2 col)
Text sizes scale appropriately across breakpoints
Icon sizes scale appropriately (w-10 to w-12)
Cards remain readable and well-proportioned at all sizes
Touch targets are adequate on mobile (cards are large enough)
technical: All required Lucide icons properly imported
Icon mapping object correctly maps icon names to components
Works with both English and Hebrew translations (RTL support via next-intl)

icon_mapping_pattern.description: Dynamic icon rendering based on translation data
icon_mapping_pattern.code_example: const iconMap = { zap: Zap, eye: Eye, target: Target, handshake: Handshake }; const IconComponent = iconMap[value.icon]; return <IconComponent className='...' />

animation_simplicity.description: Values component uses simpler animations than Stats
animation_simplicity.rationale: No counters or scroll triggers needed - pure CSS fade-in is sufficient
animation_simplicity.implementation: Apply animate-fade-in-up with inline animationDelay prop

rtl_support.description: Component should work with both English (LTR) and Hebrew (RTL)
considerations: Icon position (justify-start works for both LTR and RTL)
Text alignment (natural left/right based on dir attribute)
Grid layout remains 2x2 in both directions
rtl_support.implementation: next-intl handles dir attribute automatically, no custom RTL classes needed

content_length.description: Ensure value descriptions are consistent length for visual balance
content_length.visual_impact: Similar-length descriptions create balanced, professional grid appearance

hover_behavior.description: Cards have hover effects but are not clickable

performance.description: Lightweight component with no heavy dependencies
benefits: CSS animations = better performance than JS
